page.title: 15Buildings
page.content: Most of the houses in Peak Forest are built of{limestone.}The older houses used to have grey slate (gritstone) roofs and gritstone was often used for window surrounds and quoins. Traditional barns were built in the same way but are nowadays usually built with a concrete framework, concrete lower walls and corrugated sheeting for the upper walls and roof. Most new houses are made to look {traditional}using modern materials where appropriate.{Planning controls often require small windows, hardrow tiles to look like grey slates and limestone is often used with an inner skin of concrete blocks or bricks. There is{friction}at times with the Peak Park Planning Board over planning controls .
